intro: Boehmeria rotundifolia, commonly known as roundleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other members commonly referred to as nettles. The plant is characterized by its smooth, rounded leaves and can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fibers of Boehmeria rotundifolia are used in traditional papermaking and textile production.
